intro: Macrocnemum stipulaceum, commonly known as the stipulate macrocnemum, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Polygonaceae. It is characterized by its slender, erect stems and small, lance-shaped leaves with distinct stipules. The plant produces clusters of tiny, greenish-white flowers that bloom in late summer. It is native to certain regions of Asia and is often found in moist, shaded environments. Due to its ornamental value and ecological significance, it is occasionally cultivated in botanical gardens.
